Detailed Description

This filter is a specialisation of AvatarFilter that implements flocking behaviour for the models that make up an entity.

This would normally be used for an entity such as a flock of birds or a school of fish which has many models driven by one entity.

The interpolation of the Entity position is done using the same logic as its parent AvatarFilter. However, it also updates the positions of individual models (which are known, according to flocking conventions, as boids) that are attached to the entity, using standard flocking rules.

void BoidsFilter::output ( double  time  )  [virtual]

This method updates its owner entities position as well as the auxiliary embodiment of the entity in such a was as to produce flocking behaviour of those embodiments.

The individual 'boids' are each encapsulated in a BoidData object which are each updated during this output.

This method also initiates a python callback on the entity when the 'landed' state changes.
Entity.boidsLanded()

Parameters:
time The client game time in seconds that the entity's volatile members should be updated for.
See also:
BoidData::updateModel()

Reimplemented from AvatarFilter.

Member Data Documentation

float BoidsFilter::ANGLE_TWEAK [protected]

This member determines the speed at which the boids adjust their pitch.


Units: radians per 30th of a second.

See also:
BoidsFilter::BoidData::updateModel()

float BoidsFilter::COLLISION_FRACTION [protected]

The collision fraction defines the proportion of the influence radius within which neighbours will be considered colliding.

float BoidsFilter::GOAL_APPROACH_RADIUS [protected]

This member holds the distance within which landing boids will snap to face their target.

float BoidsFilter::GOAL_STOP_RADIUS [protected]

This member holds the distance within which boids are considered to have reached their target and will stop.

float BoidsFilter::INFLUENCE_RADIUS [protected]

This member is used to define the distance at which boids begin receiving influence from other boids.

float BoidsFilter::NORMAL_SPEED [protected]

The normal speed of the boids.

While boids will speed up and slow down during flocking, their speed will always be damped toward this speed.

Note:
Python name is 'speed'

float BoidsFilter::PITCH_TO_SPEED_RATIO [protected]

This member defines how much the boids will slowdown or speedup based on their rate of climb or decent.

Units: metres per second per radian

float BoidsFilter::state_ [protected]

Controls whether the boids are flying or landing.

By default they are in the flying state which is specified with 0. The landing state will cause the boids to land and is specified with 1. When a boid lands the method boidsLanded is called.

Note:
Python name is 'state_'
